statement.p: Find the slope of the line that goes through the points (4,-2) and (9,1).
Enter your answer as an integer or a reduced fraction in the form A/B

ul.li: \displaystyle\frac{{{1}-{\left(-{2}\right)}}}{{{9}-{\left({4}\right)}}}=\frac{{3}}{{5}} which reduces to \displaystyle\frac{{3}}{{5}} (if it's not already reduced)
